intro: Hieracium taygetum, commonly known as the Taygetian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats, often at higher elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to reddish-brown. Hieracium taygetum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in alpine meadows.
